page.title: 15THE HOLYMOORSIDE COTTON MILL
page.content:
In the late 18th century a cotton mill was built in Holymoorside. In 1833 the mill was described to be stone built and three stories high. Apart from a good water supply other advantages were a good bridle path into Chesterfield and a good cart road without a toll to nearby coal pits. The mill was first powered by a waterwheel fed from a large mill pond. Water was transferred from the River Hipper into the pond via a small channel.
Today the mill pond is used for fishing. Many perch and roach have been introduced to keep the lake well stocked. The Holymoorside Angling Society uses the lake for its fishing. Each year the society organises a fishing competition around the lake.
